structural_unit_name.en: Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies

description.en:
The course "The EU in the world" introduces students to the nature and functioning of the European Union as an international actor. While the primary purpose of the European project continues to be fostering peace and prosperity on the continent, managing the EU's relations with the outside world has gained salience over time, both as a matter of necessity ('being secure in an insecure world') and as a matter of increasing ambition ('Europe living up to its potential'). 

In response, the EU has gradually emerged as an active player on the world stage over the last decades. In effect, however, the EU has repeatedly failed to live up to expectations. 

In order to understand the potential and limitations of the EU as an international actor, the course introduces students to the EU's external policies and, more generally, areas of the EU's external engagement. In addition, the course captures the EU's relations with major powers such as, most centrally, the United States, China, and Russia. Finally, the course familiarizes students with wider debates, including those that are of conceptual nature, about the EU's international role.

objectives.en: The objective of the course is to provide course participants with an understanding of the nature and functioning of the EU as an international actor. The overarching problem the course seeks to address is the question why the EU, despite continuous development of its foreign policy dimension over the last decades, remains a somewhat peculiar international actor, often seen to be "punching below its weight". The course will provide course participants with an understanding of the potentials and limits built-in to the EU's foreign policy dimension. At the same time as promoting understanding of the functioning of EU's external dimension, key conceptual debates will be introduced, enabling students to critically assess current debates about the nature of the EU's international role.
objectives.et: Õppeaine eesmärgiks on aidata tudengitel mõista EL-i olemust laiemas rahvusvahelises kontekstis. Kursuse vältel püütakse leida vastus küsimusele, miks on EL rahvusvahelisel areenil endiselt veidi kummalises "vähesaavutaja" rollis. Lisaks sellele aitab kursus mõista potentsiaali ja piiranguid, mis on EL-i välispoliitika dimensiooni sisse kirjutatud. Samuti on kursuse üheks eesmärgiks näidata, et EL-i rolli maailmas ei saa vaadelda ainult traditsioonilise välispoliitika taustal, vaid seda peaks mõistma välissuhete laiemas kontekstis.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of the course, students will be able to:
- describe and explain the institutional setup and policy-making process of the EU's external policies;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab kirjeldada EL institutsionaalset korraldust, poliitika kujundamise protsessi;

learning_outcomes.en: - describe, explain, and apply key concepts in the of EU external relations;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb EL välispoliitika erialatermineid ja oskab neid kasutada õiges kontekstis;

learning_outcomes.en: - compare and contrast the EU's international role across policy fields, contexts, and relationships with major lobal powers;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab võrrelda ja vastandada EL-i rolli erinevate valdkondade raames ja kontekstides;

learning_outcomes.en: - critically assess the EU’s role in international politics and to situate this assessment in wider debates on the EU’s external relations;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab kriitiliselt hinnata hetkediskussioone Euroopa välissuhete, EL-i regionaalse ja globaalse rolli üle;

learning_outcomes.en: - identify, synthesize and evaluate specialized literature on selected areas of the EU’s international engagement;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab tuvastada, sünteesida ja hinnata erialast kirjandust ELi rahvusvahelise tegevuse valitud valdkondade kohta.

grade_preconditions.et: Kursuse lõpphinde saamise eelduseks on kõigi nõutud ülesannete esitamine ja osalemine vähemalt viiel (5) sessioonil seitsmest (7).

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et:
Introduction
Seminar: EU foreign policy and the member states

Lecture: The EU's Common Foreign and Security Policy (CFSP)
Seminar: Policy-making in EU foreign policy

Lecture: The EU's Common Security and Defence Policy (CSDP)
Seminar: The challenge of EU defense cooperation

Lecture: External Action and the external dimension of internal policies
Seminar: EU external relations in the area of trade and climate policy

Lecture: EU-US relations
Seminar: The EU and the changing transatlantic relationship

Lecture: EU-Russia relations and beyond
Seminar: The EU and its troubled neighbourhoods

Lecture: EU-China relations
Seminar: Normative Power Europe in a less Western-centric world
